channel.title: Newest Python PEPs
channel.description: Newest Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs): Information on new language features and some meta-information like release procedure and schedules.

item.title: PEP 741: Python Configuration C API
item.description: Add a C API to the limited C API to configure the Python preinitialization and initialization, and to get the current configuration. It can be used with the stable ABI.
item.author: Victor Stinner (vstinner@python.org)

item.title: PEP 739: Static description file for Python installations
item.description: Introduce a standard format for a static description file to describe Python installations.
item.author: Filipe La√≠ns (lains@riseup.net)

item.title: PEP 738: Adding Android as a supported platform
item.description: This PEP proposes adding Android as a supported platform in CPython. The initial goal is for Android to achieve Tier 3 support in Python 3.13.
item.author: Malcolm Smith (smith@chaquo.com)

item.title: PEP 737: Unify type name formatting
item.description: Add new convenient APIs to format type names the same way in Python and in C. No longer format type names differently depending on how types are implemented.
item.author: Victor Stinner (vstinner@python.org)

item.title: PEP 736: Shorthand syntax for keyword arguments at invocation
item.description: This PEP proposes introducing syntactic sugar f(x=) for the common pattern where a named argument is the same as the name of the variable corresponding to its value f(x=x).
item.author: Joshua Bambrick (jbambrick@google.com), Chris Angelico (rosuav@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 735: Dependency Groups in pyproject.toml
item.description: This PEP specifies a mechanism for storing package requirements in pyproject.toml files such that they are not included in any built distribution of the project.
item.author: Stephen Rosen (sirosen0@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 734: Multiple Interpreters in the Stdlib
item.description: This PEP proposes to add a new module, interpreters, to support inspecting, creating, and running code in multiple interpreters in the current process. This includes Interpreter objects that represent the underlying interpreters. The module will also provide a basic Queue class for communication between interpreters. Finally, we will add a new concurrent.futures.InterpreterPoolExecutor based on the interpreters module.
item.author: Eric Snow (ericsnowcurrently@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 8105: 2024 Term Steering Council election
item.description: This document describes the schedule and other details of the 2023 election for the Python steering council, as specified in PEP 13. This is the steering council election for the 2024 term (i.e. Python 3.13).
item.author: Ee Durbin (ee@python.org)

item.title: PEP 733: An Evaluation of Python's Public C API
item.description: This informational PEP describes our shared view of the public C API. The document defines:
item.author: Erlend Egeberg Aasland (erlend@python.org), Domenico Andreoli (domenico.andreoli@linux.com), Stefan Behnel (stefan_ml@behnel.de), Carl Friedrich Bolz-Tereick (cfbolz@gmx.de), Simon Cross (hodgestar@gmail.com), Steve Dower (steve.dower@python.org), Tim Felgentreff (tim.felgentreff@oracle.com), David Hewitt (1939362+davidhewitt@users.noreply.github.com), Shantanu Jain (hauntsaninja at gmail.com), Wenzel Jakob (wenzel.jakob@epfl.ch), Irit Katriel (irit@python.org), Marc-Andre Lemburg (mal@lemburg.com), Donghee Na (donghee.na@python.org), Karl Nelson (nelson85@llnl.gov), Ronald Oussoren (ronaldoussoren@mac.com), Antoine Pitrou (solipsis@pitrou.net), Neil Schemenauer (nas@arctrix.com), Mark Shannon (mark@hotpy.org), Stepan Sindelar (stepan.sindelar@oracle.com), Gregory P. Smith (greg@krypto.org), Eric Snow (ericsnowcurrently@gmail.com), Victor Stinner (vstinner@python.org), Guido van Rossum (guido@python.org), Petr Viktorin (encukou@gmail.com), Carol Willing (willingc@gmail.com), William Woodruff (william@yossarian.net), David Woods (dw-git@d-woods.co.uk), Jelle Zijlstra (jelle.zijlstra@gmail.com)

item.title: PEP 732: The Python Documentation Editorial Board
item.author: Joanna Jablonski
